items.title: Vue Components as Custom Elements with Vue 3.2
items.content:
#â€‹551 â€” August 13, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Vue 3.2 Released â€” Some new features for single file components, significant perf improvements, and itâ€™s now easy to define native custom elements with defineCustomElement (learn more about this in Vue Components as Custom Elements â€“ this could be a big deal for many).

Evan You

'JavaScript Needs More Helper Functions for Iteration' â€” Many languages have a plethora of functions or methods for iteration, but many of JavaScriptâ€™s options came late and scoped to particular data types (such as Array's new methods in ES6) and Axel thinks we need to go a lot further while comparing a variety ofÂ approaches.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Get Started with JavaScript and InfluxDBÂ 2.0 â€” How-to guide to monitor your JavaScript application performance and create beautiful web-based visualizations with InfluxDB time seriesÂ platform.

InfluxData sponsor

V8 Release v9.3 â€” Recent V8 releases have been reasonably lean on new features, and so it goes with 9.3 which mostly gets faster compilation, Object.hasOwn (an alias for Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call), and the ability to attach error â€˜causesâ€™ to Error instances. Itâ€™s in beta until Chrome 93 (due in the coming weeks) and will appear in Node.js soonÂ too.

Ingvar Stepanyan

Next.js 11.1 Released â€” The popular React framework takes a few steps forward with experimental ES modules support, a new integration with swc to ultimately replace JS tooling (Babel and Terser), faster data mapping and source maps, andÂ more.

Vercel

QUICK BITS:

  • The first release candidate of TypeScript 4.4 has been released with support for declaring types that can be keyed on arbitrary symbols, static blocks in classes, performance improvements, and more.

  • Code House claims to be the 'world's biggest storehouse' of developer cheatsheets.

  • Firefox 91 has added support for the Visual Viewport API by default and new formats for Intl.DateTimeFormat.

  • Developers have been sharing the strangest domain names they've bought â€“ we all have a few domain skeletons in the closet, right?

  • Using JavaScript to â–¶ï¸ fly a drone with your mind.

  • A look at the new JavaScript and TypeScript dev experience in Visual Studio 2022 Preview 3 (no, not VS Code!)

RELEASES:

Node.js 16.6.2, 14.17.5, and 12.22.5
Solid 1.1.0 â€“ A declarative UI library worth investigating.
ws 8.1.0 â€“ Node WebSocket client and server library.
octokit.js 1.4.0 â€“ GitHub SDK for Node, browsers and Deno.
React Date Picker 4.2 â€“ Simple date-picker component (demo).
Ember.js 3.28.0 â€“ The long standing framework.
react-markdown 7.0 â€“ Markdown component for React.
Aurelia 2 Alpha 16

ğŸ’» Jobs

Frontend Engineering Positions - Remote ğŸ– â€” Passion for React & GraphQL? Join our product team in building a super fast headless eCommerce service developerÂ love.
Crystallize

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

How to Build Force Directed Graphs with React and D3 v7 â€” A step-by-step build from no movement to the â€˜full bells and whistlesâ€™ complete with code sandboxes to playÂ with.

Swizec Teller

Making a Web Worker Optional â€” A generic approach to make the creation of an extra Web Worker optional when one isnâ€™t strictlyÂ needed.

Tobias Uhlig

Improving Responsiveness in Text Inputs â€” requestIdleCallback to theÂ rescue in not running code immediately on every characterÂ change.

Nolan Lawson

Building React Components For Any Front End â€” React might not be as widely used so we decided to create custom components that work in any frontend setup with anyÂ UI.

Courier sponsor

â–¶Â Â Learning MongoDB by Building a Project â€” This was a livestream so is slow paced but itâ€™s also thorough and real and a nice look at how real developers approach building apps using Node, Next.js, and MongoDBâ€™s hosted Atlas service.

Florin Pop and Jesse Hall

A Quick Refresher on JavaScript Callbacks and Promises
Lydia Cupery

Choice Words about the Upcoming Deprecation of JavaScript Dialogs
Chris Coyier

<Lazy> Rendering in Vue to Improve Performance
Martin Malinda

An Old Hacker's Tips on Staying Employed
Mad Ned

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Introducing MIDIVal: The Easiest Way to Interact with MIDI in YourÂ Browser â€” Despite being 40 years old, the MIDI protocol is still heavily used by, and hugely valuable to, musicians. MIDIVal is a higher level abstraction for working with MIDI from JavaScript. Getting startedÂ tutorial.

Kacper Kula

Deno 1.13 Released â€” The 'server-side runtime that isn't Node' (but comes from the same initial creator!) has received a release with a ton of small enhancements, including its native HTTP server API going stable, language server improvements, more TLS customization options, and integrating V8Â 9.3.

The Deno Team

The Data API with Native GraphQL and JavaScript Support â€” Create a document database with an API that handles scaling, sharding and other operationally intensive tasks forÂ you.

Fauna sponsor

JSZip: Create, Read and Edit .zip Archive Files â€” Yes, it even works in all major browsers (see the demo). GitHubÂ repo.

Stuart Knightley

styled-jsx 4.0: Full CSS Support for JSX Without Compromises â€” Full, scoped and component-friendly CSS support for JSX (rendered on the server or theÂ client).

Vercel

HyperFormula: An Excel-Like Calculation Engine Written in TypeScript â€” Provides a way to add spreadsheet style calculations to your webapps. Do note itâ€™s GPLv3 licensed (or commercial) though.

Handsontable

http-server: A Simple Zero-Conf Command-Line HTTP Server â€” A lot more configurable (if you wish) than other simple command line HTTPÂ servers.

Robbins, Squires, et al.

Book a Demo. Ship Fast. Rest Easy. LaunchDarkly

LaunchDarkly sponsor

Hora: Efficient Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search Algorithms â€” This isnâ€™t a JavaScript project but a Rust one. It targets WebAssembly, though, so can be used from JavaScript as seen in the demos on theÂ homepage.

Hora-Search

FormVueLate: Vue Schema-Driven Form Generation
Marina Mosti

items.title: Wikimedia picks Vue.js
items.content:
#â€‹550 â€” August 6, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Kid Pix as a JavaScript App â€” Kid Pix was a drawing program for children released on the Mac in 1989 (hereâ€™s a full story about it, if you hadnâ€™t heard of it before). Hereâ€™s a JavaScript reimplementation. It saves your work if you go away, and the source is prettyÂ neat.

JS Kid Pix

How To Build Resilient JavaScript UIs â€” An exploration of how graceful degradation, defensive coding, observability, and a healthy attitude towards failures puts you in a better position as a JavaScriptÂ developer.

Callum Hart

We're Giving Away Free T-Shirts. Just Download FusionAuth â€” FusionAuth provides authentication, authorization, and user management for any app: deploy anywhere, integrate with anything, in minutes. It's always free for unlimited users (no CC required). Download and Install today and we'll send you aÂ t-shirt.

FusionAuth sponsor

Wikimedia Selects Vue.js For Its New Frontend Framework â€” This process began years ago (we even covered it at the time) but finally the folks behind Wikipedia have made an announcement concerning the future of their JavaScript oriented development and itâ€™s a win forÂ Vue.js.

Wikimedia Foundation

QUICK BITS:

  • ğŸ† Here's a handy guide to what's new in ES2022 to skim through.

  • The JS1024 game development contest has wrapped up with a bunch of fantastic winners â€“ it's amazing to see how much can be done with a mere 1KB of JavaScript.

  • There's a new Visual Studio Code update â€“ the Live Preview extension now supports JavaScript debugging within previews.

  • Chrome's intent to remove support for cross origin IFRAMEs to trigger window.alert, prompt and confirm dialogs has fallen into some trouble.

  • The Stack Overflow 2021 Developer Survey results are out and JavaScript has fared very well. We'll digest some of the findings in coming issues.

  • Google is shutting down its Google Sign-In JavaScript Platform Library for web in 2023.

  • Scala.js 1.7.0, a Scala to JavaScript compiler, has been released with 'zero known bugs' â€“ reassuring!

RELEASES:

Bootstrap 5.1.0 â€“ Responsive site creation toolkit.
Agenda 4.2.0 â€“ Lightweight job scheduling for Node.
Globalize 1.7.0 â€“ I18n and l10n library that uses official Unicode CLDR.
Angular 12.2 â€“ The popular JS framework.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Lead Full-Stack Software Engineer (USA) â€” Join a team of engineers and designers crafting digital products for companies such as HBO, adidas, Supercell, andÂ Nokia.
REAKTOR

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

How MDNâ€™s Autocomplete Search Works â€” Autocomplete search was recently added to the excellent MDN Web Docs. Hereâ€™s a look at how the feature wasÂ implemented.

Peter Bengtsson (Mozilla)

How to Use Promise.allSettled() â€” How to use Promise.allSettled() to perform parallel async operations and collect the promises statuses into anÂ array.

Dmitri Pavlutin

Angular Data Grids Donâ€™t Need to Be Hard. Check This One Out â€” Be ready for your next data grid project by learning about the one that has already been built forÂ you.

Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

40+ Node.js Integration Test Best Practices â€” Component and integration tests are increasingly popular testing techniques for backends. This repository digs into a variety of quick-fire patterns and practices for creating good component tests. Thereâ€™s also a demo app and examples using Jest, Mocha, Express, Fastify andÂ Nest.js.

Yoni Goldberg, Michael Solomon, and Daniel Gluskin

â–¶Â Â NestJS Explained in 100 Seconds â€” The high-level concepts of Nest, a framework for building scalable Node.js applications that offers more beyond what you might get with something like Express or Fastify alone, presented in around twoÂ minutes.

Fireship

Rendering Magical Marbles with Three.js â€” These sorts of 3D graphics tricks are a bit over my head, but itâ€™s neat to see how theyâ€™reÂ done.

Matt Rossman

Optional Chaining: The ?. Operator in TypeScript â€” TypeScript 3.7 added support for the ?. operator, also known as the optional chainingÂ operator.

Marius Schulz

Auth Without Complexity â€” Here is a much simpler way to build authentication and access control, with examples for React, Vue, Node.js & more.

Userfront sponsor

How We Reduced Next.js Page Size by 3.5x and Achieved a 98 LighthouseÂ Score
Colin Armstrong

How to Use test.todo() in Jest
Kanisorn Sutham

(Why and How to) Visit the Blank Page Between Cypress Tests
Gleb Bahmutov

Automating Accessibility Testing with Storybook
Varun Vachhar (Storybook)

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Meyda: A JavaScript Audio Feature Extraction Library â€” The homepage has quite a visually striking demo. It supports both offline feature extraction as well as real-time feature extraction using the Web AudioÂ API.

Rawlinson, Segal, Fiala, Wray, et al.

txiki.js: A Small and Powerful JavaScript Runtime â€” Stands on the shoulders of QuickJS andÂ libuv.

SaÃºl Ibarra CorretgÃ©

XRegExp 5.1: Extended JavaScript Regular Expressions â€” This is for you if you want to â€˜spice upâ€™ normal regular expressions beyond what browsers support natively â€“Â see theÂ examples.

Steven Levithan

Tesseract.js 2.1.5: Pure JavaScript OCR for 100+ Languages â€” A pure JavaScript port of the popular C++ Tesseract library commonly used for visual text recognitionÂ purposes.

Tesseract Team

React Hot Toast 2.0 â€” React Hot Toast is a popular React on-page notifications system. Although the opportunity to customize the notifications in the new release chips away at the original â€˜toastâ€™ metaphor, thereâ€™s a lot of configurability in the new version that will prove valuable for many. It also has better accessability and a custom renderer. GitHub repo.

Timo Lins

Why You Need Error Grouping - How to Minimize Noise, Pinpoint the Right Errors, and Debug Better

Rollbar sponsorwhitepaper

React Joyride: Create Guided Tours in Your Apps â€” Uses react-floater to position and style floating â€˜tour guideâ€™ elements. Want a demo? Of course youÂ do.

Gil Barbara

AutoMapper 5.0: An Object-Object AutoMapper for TypeScript â€” GitHubÂ repo.

Chau Tran

ts-audio 0.6.0: Work with AudioContext More Easily â€” Hereâ€™s aÂ demo.

Evandro Leopoldino GonÃ§alves

items.title: Beating the JavaScript drum
items.content:
#â€‹549 â€” July 30, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Using console.log() Debugging in Visual Studio Code â€” Using the JavaScript debugger in VS Code you can access the browser developer tools console right inside theÂ editor. Ideal if you're in that happy majority of console.log debuggers?Â :-)

Christian Heilmann

Node v16.6.0 (Current) Released â€” The latest Node release brings V8 9.2 to the party which introduces Array.prototype.at. The inspector module (used to interact with the V8 inspector is now also consideredÂ stable.

Bethany Nicolle Griggs

Learn the Fundamentals of Redux â€” Add scalable, production-ready state management into your React app and extend Redux's abilities with tools like Reselect, Immer, and ReduxÂ Toolkit.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Yarn 3.0: What's New in the Alternative JavaScript DependencyÂ Manager â€” Yarn was born at Facebook in 2016 as an alternative (and, at the time, improvement) to npm. Both npm and Yarn have evolved since then, and the big jump to Yarn 2 put some people off. Yarn 3 is a smoother transition â€” hereâ€™s theÂ changelog.

MaÃ«l Nison

ğŸ¥ Â Drum Synthesis in JavaScript â€” The creator of Elementary, a system for building audio apps in JavaScript, shows off how he went about creating a drum synth on top ofÂ it.

Nick Thompson

How Do Chrome Extensions Impact Browser Performance? â€” This report investigates how 1000 of the most popular Chrome extensions impact browser performance and end-userÂ experience.

Matt Zeunert

QUICK BITS:

  • Node.js has received a raft of immediate security releases to fix an http2 module related vulnerability.

  • Google is introducing a new Firebase JavaScript SDK which will demand you update your code.

  • A fun look at content-aware image resizing in JavaScript with seam carving.

  • Tadeu Zagallo of the JavaScriptCore team at Apple shares some experiences on optimizing JS standard library functions in the WebKit JavaScript engine.

RELEASES:

prettier-eslint 13.0 â€“ Format using Prettier then eslint --fix
ws 8.0 â€“ Node.js WebSocket client and server library.
Plotly.js 2.3 â€“ JS data visualization library.
date-fns 2.23.0 â€“ Modern JavaScript date utility library.
Recoil 0.4.0 â€“ Experimental state management for React apps.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Full Stack Utviklere â€” Visma sÃ¸ker utvikler i Norge eller Sverige. Avansert javascriptutvikling som minner mer om spillprogrammering enn tradisjonellÂ koding.
Visma

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

Gatsby Serverless Functions and the International Space Station â€” Many eyes have been set on reaching space lately, but Paul Scanlon is busy looking at the ISS and shows how to put together an app to track its location on a 3D globe, all powered by React, Three.js and Gatsby's Functions platform.

Paul Scanlon

JavaScript's 'Forgotten' Keyword: with â€” Iâ€™m linking to this because itâ€™s an interesting appendage from JavaScriptâ€™s history thatâ€™s worth knowing about in case you see it, but that you should avoid usingÂ yourself.

Randall X

How To Build an E-Commerce Site with Angular 11 & Commerce Layer â€” Commerce Layer is a â€˜commerce API for developersâ€™ (sort of a headless Shopify, I guess) and this very extensive walkthrough covers integrating it with an Angular app of yourÂ own.

Zara Cooper

The Definitive Guide to Feature Management

LaunchDarkly sponsor

NFC Comes to the Web â€” NFC functionality is now widely available on the hardware side, with browser support slowly gaining (for example: Chrome for Android 91 now supports WebNFC). As such, Sven has been experimenting with the technology and captured his thoughts here (along with a few codeÂ examples).

Sven Haiges

On WebView2 and Electron â€” An explanation of the difference between WebView2, a Microsoft Edge-based control for embedding web views into native apps, and what the Electron.js projectÂ does.

Electron.js Team

Global vs. Local Styling in Next.js â€” Approaching the topic of structuring CSS nicely within Next-poweredÂ apps.

Alexander Dubovoy

How to Build a Modern Shopping Site with Astro and Serverless Functions
Cassidy Williams

Mocking the Modular AWS SDK for JavaScript (v3) in Unit Tests
Trivikram Kamat (AWS)

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Size Limit 5: A Performance Budgeting Tool for JavaScript â€” Calculate the real cost to run your JS app or lib to keep good performance and raise an error in CI if the cost exceeded some defined limit. Supports ES modules and treeÂ shaking.

Andrey Sitnik

Quickly See Logs in LogDNA â€” The Node.js library lets you send logs from your Node.js and JavaScript apps to LogDNA, where theyâ€™re automaticallyÂ parsed.

LogDNA sponsor

JSON Blob: Create, Edit, View, Format, and Share JSONÂ Online â€” A handy tool in its own right, but it also has an API so could hook in more places than expected. Thanks to Simon Plenderleith for the tipÂ here.

Tristan Burch

JavaScript Cookie 3.0: A Simple API for Handling BrowserÂ Cookies â€” Browsers already offer an API for working with cookies, but this adds a little more abstraction. Whatâ€™s new inÂ v3.0.

Hartl, Brack, et al.

React-Tracking 9.0: Declarative Tracking for React Apps â€” Iâ€™m a big fan of their crosswords, but the NY Times puts out a lot of codeÂ too.

The New York Times

Svelte Storm: An Interesting Open Source Svelte IDE â€” It has a built in state manager window for viewing whatâ€™s going on in realÂ time.

OSLabs Beta

Tried. Tested. Trusted. Studio 3T - Power Tools forÂ MongoDB â€” Intuitive IntelliShell. Generate JavaScript from queries. Reshape data with Reschema. Try Studio 3T free for 30Â days.

Studio 3T sponsor

Sift: MongoDB Style Queries for JavaScript Objects â€” I canâ€™t quite put my finger on the use case here, but you may haveÂ one.

Craig Condon

IdB-Keyval 5.1: A 'Super-Simple-Small' Promise-Based IndexedDB-Powered Keyval Store
Jake Archibald

svelte-undo: A Small Utility for Managing an Undo Stack
Rich Harris

html-to-image: Generate Images from DOM Nodes using Canvas and SVG
W.Y.
items.contentSnippet:
#â€‹549 â€” July 30, 2021


UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web



JavaScript Weekly




  





  
  
Using console.log() Debugging in Visual Studio Code â€” Using the JavaScript debugger in VS Code you can access the browser developer tools console right inside theÂ editor. Ideal if you're in that happy majority of console.log debuggers?Â :-)
Christian Heilmann 


  
  
Node v16.6.0 (Current) Released â€” The latest Node release brings V8 9.2 to the party which introduces Array.prototype.at. The inspector module (used to interact with the V8 inspector is now also consideredÂ stable.
Bethany Nicolle Griggs 


  
  
Learn the Fundamentals of Redux â€” Add scalable, production-ready state management into your React app and extend Redux's abilities with tools like Reselect, Immer, and ReduxÂ Toolkit.
Frontend Masters sponsor


  
  
Yarn 3.0: What's New in the Alternative JavaScript DependencyÂ Manager â€” Yarn was born at Facebook in 2016 as an alternative (and, at the time, improvement) to npm. Both npm and Yarn have evolved since then, and the big jump to Yarn 2 put some people off. Yarn 3 is a smoother transition â€” hereâ€™s theÂ changelog.
MaÃ«l Nison 


  
  
ğŸ¥ Â Drum Synthesis in JavaScript â€” The creator of Elementary, a system for building audio apps in JavaScript, shows off how he went about creating a drum synth on top ofÂ it.
Nick Thompson 


  
  
How Do Chrome Extensions Impact Browser Performance? â€” This report investigates how 1000 of the most popular Chrome extensions impact browser performance and end-userÂ experience.
Matt Zeunert 





QUICK BITS:
Node.js has received a raft of immediate security releases to fix an http2 module related vulnerability.
Google is introducing a new Firebase JavaScript SDK which will demand you update your code.
A fun look at content-aware image resizing in JavaScript with seam carving.
Tadeu Zagallo of the JavaScriptCore team at Apple shares some experiences on optimizing JS standard library functions in the WebKit JavaScript engine.

items.title: JS debugging now built in to VS Code
items.content:
#â€‹548 â€” July 23, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

JetBrains' 2021 Developer Ecosystem Survey Results â€” Over 30,000 developers took the State of Developer Ecosystem 2021 survey, with 70% being JavaScript users. You can find the JavaScript-specific results here. Some interesting stats came ofÂ this:

  • React is regularly used by 49% of respondents, with Vue.js at 43%.
  • Go, TypeScript, and Python are the most common other languages JavaScript developers plan to learn soon.
  • 42% claim to not to write unit tests regularly.
  • Home working is, unsurprisingly, suddenly popular with 83% of developers WFH compared to 31% pre-pandemic.

JetBrains

ğŸ’¡ If you like this sort of thing, last year's State of JS results may also be of interest.

Easier Browser Debugging with Developer Tools Integration in VSÂ Code â€” If youâ€™re a VS Code user, you no longer have to use the Chrome Debugger or Edge Debugging extension as JavaScript debugging is now built in to the popular editor. Christian Heilmann has more on thisÂ here.

Microsoft Edge Blog

Locate and Resolve JavaScript Errors Instantly with Datadog â€” Troubleshoot user-facing incidents and resolve frontend JavaScript errors in context with the ability to correlate error logs with individual user sessions with one click. Try it yourself with a free DatadogÂ trial.

Datadog sponsor

Plate 1.0: A Plugin Framework for Building Rich Text Editors with Slate â€” Slate is a framework for building rich text editor controls, and Plate abstracts things one level higher offering a plugin system for adding your own functionality. Look at the big demo on the homepage to see the benefits. GitHubÂ repo.

Taylor, Beyens and Murray

Node-RED 2.0 Released â€” Node-RED is a now very mature â€˜low-codeâ€™ Node.js-based programming environment, particularly aimed at connecting together services or IoT devices. The 2.0 release focuses on upgrading dependencies, dropping old Node version support, and an (optional) improved textÂ editor.

OpenJS Foundation

QUICK BITS:

  • It's not of much use, but technically a URL can be validÂ JavaScript.

  • After years in beta, Fastly has launched its Compute@Edge serverless edge computeÂ platform.

  • A beautiful example of photorealistic glass in the browser using Three.js.

RELEASES:

Hyper 3.1 â€“ JS-powered terminal app.
RxDB 10.0 â€“ Realtime database for JavaScript apps.
AdminJS 5.1 â€“ Automatic admin interface for Node apps.
GoldenLayout 2.3 â€“ Multi-screen layout manager for webapps.
flv.js 1.6 â€“ HTML5 FLV Player.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Love Writing Code? Now Build Products as a Product Manager â€” We are hiring expert devs who want to become product managers. Help build products that are executed millions of times aÂ day.
SignalWire

Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer (USA) â€” Ready to do your best work in a team that truly supports you? Join a culture that values autonomy, freedom, andÂ collaboration.
REAKTOR

Find a Job Through Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“–Â Articles, Opinions & Tutorials

Simple Monorepos via npm Workspaces and TypeScript Project References â€” How to set up a simple monorepo for two npm packages using just what comes with npm andÂ TypeScript.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

â–¶Â Â Code Zelda in JavaScript with Kaboom.js â€” Ania is back with another fun walkthrough. For your hour this time you get to build the bare bones of a NES-era ZeldaÂ game.

Ania KubÃ³w

5 Reasons Not to Write Your JavaScript Data Grid from Scratch â€” Data grids are essential for every business app. Before you decide to roll your own, learn about these commonÂ pitfalls.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

Trackball Rotation using Quaternions â€” How can you implement a 3D â€˜trackballâ€™ that you can control with a 2D interface like a typical trackpad? With Trackball.js is how.. but you can attempt to understand the math in this article if youÂ wish.

Robert Eisele

then(f,f) vs then(f).catch(f) â€” A quick look at the difference between two approaches withÂ promises.

Dmitri Pavlutin

Building a 'Typewriter Animation' That Handles Anything You Throw at It â€” A thorough dig into whatâ€™s involved in creating an interesting frontend effect with JavaScript. The end result looksÂ neat.

Murtuzaali Surti

[Free Workshop] Building an IoT application with InfluxDB â€” Learn how to develop a JavaScript-enabled time-series-based application using Kafka queues, RabbitMQ and InfluxDBÂ Cloud.

InfluxData sponsor

Creating a Typography Motion Trail Effect with Three.js
George Nikolov

Three Insights I Gained While Researching Vue.js Accessibility
Marcus Herrmann

Building a â€˜Table Of Contentsâ€™ with Active Indicator using Intersection Observers
Ben Frain

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Dinero.js: A Library for Working with Monetary Values â€” Express monetary values and perform mutations, conversions, comparisons, handle formatting, and generally make money manipulation easier. GitHubÂ repo.

Sarah Dayan

Abracadabra: JS and TS Refactoring Tool for VS Code â€” While VS Code supports some refactoring techniques out of the box, Abracadabra magics up many more including numerous conditional logic changes, inlining, and syntax conversions. It can also suggest â€˜quick fixesâ€™ - refactorings that make sense in the currentÂ context.

Visual Studio Marketplace

Color: A Color Conversion and Manipulation Library â€” Immutable color conversion and manipulation with support for CSS colorÂ strings.

Qix

Clubhouse.io - We Put the Agile in Agile and the 'Can' in Kanban

Clubhouse.io sponsor

Tangram: An Automated Machine Learning Framework â€” Itâ€™s not solely for Ruby â€“ indeed, itâ€™s written in Rust â€“ but you can train a model from a CSV file and then make â€˜predictionsâ€™ from JavaScript (or Ruby, or Python) code. GitHubÂ repo.

Tangram

Bulletproof React: An Architecture for React Apps â€” Using a group chat app as the case study, the author touches on every significant aspect of building and deploying a React application which will make it â€œbulletproofâ€ and therefore production ready. Note, however: "This is not supposed to be a template or a framework. It is an opinionated guide that shows how to do some things in a certain way."

Alan Alickovic

Color Thief: Grab Color Palettes from Images â€” Given an image, this uses canvas to return a list of the dominantÂ colors.

Lokesh Dhakar

FZF for JavaScript: Fuzzy Finding for the Browser â€” fzf is a tool written in Go for â€˜fuzzy findingâ€™ files but here the idea has been adapted to JavaScript and the Web so it can be used for similar fuzzy finding inÂ webapps.

ajit

veux-persistedstate: Persist and Rehydrate Your Vuex State Between Page Reloads
Robin van der Vleuten

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
